intro: Hieracium sonchoides subsp. aracioides, commonly known as the broadleaf hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring basal leaves that are broadly ovate to lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped cluster, and it produces small, oval-shaped achenes as its fruit. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas.
